Twitter            Higher production and lower demand outlooks supported more losses for August Nymex natural gas futures as weather forecasts softened heat for later in July amid storm fears stoked by the formation of the earliest Category 5 hurricane on record.   Expand    At A Glance:  Futures end down 4.3 centsProduction hits three-month highWeather, LNG worries pressure      Related Tags    Hurricance   NYMEX   matterhorn express pipeline   natural gas prices   Natural gas futures   California   Plaquemines LNG            Jodi Shafto     Jodi Shafto joined NGI as a Senior Natural Gas Reporter in October 2023. Before that, she was a business news reporter for South Carolina's largest daily newspaper, The Post and Courier, and was a Senior Energy Markets Reporter at S&P Global Market Intelligence. Based out of Charleston, Jodi has covered US energy markets since 2005 as a reporter, editor and analyst. A New Jersey native, she holds a BS in Journalism from Bowling Green State University.      X  JodiNGI   Email  jodi.shafto@naturalgasintel.com                    August Futures Reverse Course, Finishing Lower Amid Modest Cooldown; Cash Up     Daily Gas Price Index Natural Gas Prices     July 09, 2024   Natural gas futures reversed early gains in an apparent shrugging off of the impacts of former Hurricane Beryl as the market focused instead on revised weather outlooks that erased cooling degree days (CDD), even as excessive heat is expected to grip large portions of the country.        Natural Gas Prices Poised to Rally Through Back Half of 2024 and Next Year, EIA Says     Daily Gas Price Index Natural Gas Prices     July 09, 2024   Benchmark natural gas spot prices are poised to jump this summer and prove substantially stronger through the balance of 2024, according to updated federal forecasts.        Greater Houston Area Recovering from Deadly Beryl, but Freeport LNG Still 'Ramped Down'     Daily Gas Price Index LNG Natural Gas Prices     July 09, 2024   The major ports along the upper Texas coast were set to reopen on Tuesday as cleanup continued in the aftermath of former Hurricane Beryl, but operations at a major LNG export facility remained shuttered.        Natural Gas Futures Extend Gains as Beryl Gives Way to Hot Weather, Production Slowdown     Daily Gas Price Index Natural Gas Prices     July 09, 2024   Natural gas futures rose in early trading Tuesday as extreme heat in the West and a sharp day/day drop in production added further fuel to a rally in the wake of Hurricane Beryl's strike of the Texas coast.        Natural Gas Futures Climb as Hot Weather Forecasts, Production Ramp Counters Beryl's Impact     Daily Gas Price Index Natural Gas Prices     July 08, 2024   August Nymex natural gas futures settled up 5.2 cents on Monday in a relief rally following eight days of decline.        Oversold Natural Gas Futures Move Up in Relief Rally as Market Eyes Hurricane Impact     Daily Gas Price Index Natural Gas Prices     July 08, 2024   August natural gas futures began the week deep in oversold territory but with a clear line of sight on the next key technical support level should Hurricane Beryl cause significant demand destruction.
